titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. F. Y. Young and William Burge, Indictment
CWG6562

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Muhlenberg Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } May Term 1865
F. Y. Young, William Burge

The Grand Jury of Muhlenberg County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse F. Y Young and William Burge of the offense of unlawfully carrying away property committed as follows towit:

The said F Y Young and William Burge on the 10th day of December 1864 in the County aforesaid "willfully knowingly and unlawfully took from the possession of S. A. Jackson and carried away but not with felonious intent" One horse the personal property of said Jackson of the value of Two Hundred dollars and against the will and consent of said S. A. Jackson and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

A N Davis
Foreman Grand Jury
E. P. Campbell atty
for Commonwealth

Witnesses
S. A. Jackson
Tolbert Robertson
John S. Young
Robert Glenn
Jas Fox
John Dearing
endorsed -- "a true bill A N Davis foreman Grand Jury, Filed in open court May 15, 1865
"Bench Warrant to issue & bail fixed at $100 each,

A Copy
Attest: Jesse H Reno C M C C
By Tho. J. Jones D. C.

Comth of Ky
vs } Copy of Indictment
F. Y. Young &c
